title: Training for the Marathon
content: Writing for academic publication is a slog; a marathon not a sprint; or perhaps a number of marathons. And yet, there is no shortcut: it is always going to be 26.2 miles. So to set out to write a paper for publication is a huge undertaking and will represent a vast investment of time, energy and emotion. This is hardly surprising. As Catrin Owen points out in, running an actual marathon and running a PhD marathon share similarities in that they are both tough at times. But both have taught her to be more disciplined, to break down tasks into smaller chunks and to take time off without feeling guilty.11
